verse: Benjamin became the father of Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, Aharah the third,
Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.
Bela had sons: Addar, Gera, Abihud,
Abishua, Na’aman, Ahoah,
Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.
These are the sons of Ehud. They are the heads of fathers’ households for the inhabitants of Geba who were exiled to Manahath,
namely, Na’aman, Ahijah, and Gera, who led them into exile, and he became the father of Uzza and Ahihud.
Shaharaim became a father in the territory of Moab, after he had sent away his wives Hushim and Ba’ara.
By his wife Hodesh he became the father of Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malkam,
Jeuz, Shakia, and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of the houses of their fathers.
By Hushim, he became the father of Abitub and Elpa’al.
The sons of Elpa’al were Eber, Misham, and Shemed, who built Ono and Lod, with its towns.
Also Beriah and Shema, who were heads of houses of the fathers of the inhabitants of Aijalon. They put to flight the inhabitants of Gath.
Also Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth,
Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,
Michael, Ishpah, Joha, who were the sons of Beriah.
Also Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,
Ishmerai, Izliah, Jobab, the sons of Elpa’al.
Also Jakim, Zikri, Zabdi,
Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,
Adaiah, Beraiah, Shimrath, the sons of Shimei.
Also Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,
Abdon, Zikri, Hanan,
Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,
Iphdeiah, Penuel, the sons of Shashak.
Also Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,
Ja’areshiah, Elijah, Zikri, and the sons of Jeroham.
These were heads of fathers’ households throughout their generations, head men. These lived in Jerusalem.
Jeiel, the father of Gibeon, whose wife’s name was Ma’akah, lived in Gibeon
with his firstborn son Abdon. Other sons were Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
Gedor, Ahio, and Zeker.
Mikloth became the father of Shimeah. They also lived near their brothers in Jerusalem, with their brothers.
